section.title: What is DOM4J?
section.p: DOM4J is an Open Source XML framework for Java. DOM4J allows you to read, write, navigate, create and modify XML documents and tree structures. DOM4J integrates with DOM and SAX and comes complete with XPath support.

section.title: Why not use JDOM?
section.p: We want to use interfaces to specify the XML tree structure while allowing any implementation to be plugged into the framework. Currently JDOM only allows you to derive from concrete base classes with quite a lot of instance variables which we find an unnecessary waste of memory and computation.

section.title: Why not use DOM?
section.p: DOM is a quite large language independent API. DOM4J is a smaller, lighter weight and simpler Java API which makes extensive use of the Java platform such as the Java 2 collections.

section.title: What features are optional in DOM4J?
section.p: In DOM4J being able to navigate up a tree towards the parent and to be able to change a tree are optional features. There are some helper methods to determine if optional features are implemented. Here is some example code to demonstrate these features.

section.title: Does DOM4J support the Visitor Pattern?
section.p: Yes. DOM4J supports the visitor pattern via the TreeVisitor interface.
